title: How to Create a Minecraft PE Server

steps.title: Make sure you're connected to Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Make sure you're connected to Wi-Fi. Your iPhone or Android must be using a Wi-Fi connection (not cellular data) for this method to work. You'll also need to be running the most recent version of Minecraft. If you haven't already done so, update Minecraft PE before proceeding.

steps.title: Open Minecraft.
steps.content: Open Minecraft. Tap the Minecraft app icon, which resembles a grassy block of dirt.

steps.title: Tap Sign In.
steps.content: Tap Sign In . It's on the left side of the screen. If you see your Xbox Live account name here, skip this step and the next one.

steps.title: Enter your Xbox Live credentials.
steps.content: Enter your Xbox Live credentials. Type in your email address and tap Next , type in your password and tap Next , and tap Let's play when prompted.

steps.title: Tap Play.
steps.content: Tap Play . It's at the top of the list of menu options in the middle of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the Worlds tab.
steps.content: Tap the Worlds tab. This option is in the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Create New.
steps.content: Tap Create New . It's at the top of the Worlds page.

steps.title: Tap the New Realm tab.
steps.content: Tap the New Realm tab. You'll find this at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Create New Realm.
steps.content: Tap Create New Realm . It's near the top of the page.

steps.title: Name your Realm.
steps.content: Name your Realm. Tap the "Realm Name" text box, then type in whatever you want to name the Realm.

steps.title: Select a tier.
steps.content: Select a tier. By default, your Realm will host 10 players in addition to you; if you want to host a cheaper server for a couple of friends, you can tap 2 Players under the "Tier" heading.

steps.title: Check the "I agree" box.
steps.content: Check the "I agree" box. It's on the left-hand side of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the Create button.
steps.content: Tap the Create button. This is at the bottom of the screen. If prompted to enter your passcode, Touch ID, or payment information, do so before proceeding.

steps.title: Tap Subscribe when prompted.
steps.content: Tap Subscribe when prompted. Doing so will create your Realm under the name you assigned to it. You can cancel your Realms subscription at any time by tapping the pencil icon next to your Realm, tapping Subscription , tapping Manage Subscription , and following the on-screen options to cancel your subscription. To view Realm options, tap the pencil icon to the right of your Realm. You can change options such as difficulty here.

steps.title: Open the Aternos website.
steps.content: Open the Aternos website. Go to https://aternos.org/go in your computer's web browser.

steps.title: Click Create your server.
steps.content: Click Create your server . It's a blue button in the middle of the page.

steps.title: Enter a username.
steps.content: Enter a username. In the "Choose a username" text box, type in whatever username you want to assign to yourself while in your server.

steps.title: Click the "I agree" switch.
steps.content: Click the "I agree" switch. It's a white "X" on a red background. You should see a checkmark replace the "X".

steps.title: Click Next.
steps.content: Click Next . This is at the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Enter an email address and password.
steps.content: Enter an email address and password. Fill out the following fields: Email — Type in an email address to which you have access. Password — Enter a password different than the one used for your email address. Retype Password — Re-enter the password.

steps.title: Click Sign up.
steps.content: Click Sign up . It's at the bottom of the page. Doing so takes you to your Aternos dashboard. If you're using an ad-blocker, you'll receive a warning on the next page. You can either turn off your ad-blocker and reload the page, or click the Continue with adblocker anyway button.

steps.title: Click the Software.
steps.content: Click the Software . This tab is on the left-hand side of the page.

steps.title: Click Win10 / MCPE.
steps.content: Click Win10 / MCPE . It's on the right-hand side of the page.

steps.title: Click Reinstall.
steps.content: Click Reinstall . You'll see this in the top-right side of the window.

steps.title: Click Yes, Reinstall when prompted.
steps.content: Click Yes, Reinstall when prompted. This will install PocketMine as an add-on for your Aternos server.

steps.title: Click the Server tab.
steps.content: Click the Server tab. It's on the left-hand side of the page.

steps.title: Click Start.
steps.content: Click Start . This green button is in the middle of the page.

steps.title: Click Connect.
steps.content: Click Connect . It's near the top of the page. Doing so prompts a pop-up window.

steps.title: Note the server address and port number.
steps.content: Note the server address and port number. You'll see both of these in a pop-up window; both are required information for setting up your Minecraft PE server.

steps.title: Connect to your server.
steps.content: Connect to your server. To enter your server and begin playing, do the following: Open Minecraft PE. Tap Play . Tap the Servers tab. Tap Add Server . Enter a name for the server in the "Server Name" text box. Enter your server's address in the "Server Address" text box. Enter your server's port number in the "Port" text box. Tap Play .
